title: August 12
description:
We went to the dentist a few times over the last few weeks. Once for regular check-ups, then back to fix cavities and for an orthodontist consultation.

For the very first time, Milo had a cavity. They gave him nitrous oxide and he fell asleep while they worked on his tooth. Not too traumatic.

Felix has had many many cavities in his short life (12? 15? we lost count) but never on a permanent tooth so hopefully this means that his permanent teeth are made of better stuff than his baby teeth. The dentist expressed concerned that his X-ray showed that he might need braces soon. We were nervous going to the orthodontist consultation. Fortunately, the orthodontist declared that his X-ray is NOT cause for concerns. Felix does not need braces and it's unlikely he ever will. What a relief! Also, we learned that he only has 5 more baby teeth to loose. Wow! Milo has 16 more baby teeth to lose.

children.title: Amy
children.description:
A sad thing happened this week: Amy, an old friend, died. This is a photo of her and Eliot from back in the days when our sons were babies.

Amy was the driving force in organizing the YogaMamas, a mother's group that sprouted from a few of us doing prenatal yoga together. We did many things together during the baby and toddler years. We had more or less lost touch but her tragic death was deeply felt nonetheless. She was 42.

May you rest in peace, Amy.

children.title: Tilden
children.description: Felix and Milo spent a week at Monkey Business, a day camp in Tilden. Lucie took full advantage of a slow work week and beautiful weather. After dropping off the kids, she took a daily hike in Tilden Park -- a different one each day. Bonus: blackberries are in season and made for a tasty snack along the trails.

children.title: Garage Sale
children.description: Lucie and the kids spent a few days going through their rooms and through the garage. We sorted all the stuff we no longer need or play with. We had a garage sale with all the rejects.

children.title: Customers
children.description: Felix did a great job advising potential customers.

children.title: R2D2
children.description:
Yup. Even some old favorites like R2D2 and the Millenium Falcon got the boot. The kids were much less sentimental about it than Lucie.

All in all, the garage sale was a success. We sold most of the stuff and now our garage and the kids' rooms feel wonderfully roomy.

children.title: La Loma
children.description:
We had heard for a long time about this guy who shows up at La Loma park every Sunday morning and offers archery lesson for $15/hour.

We finally got our act together and looked up where the heck La Loma park is. It's not that far from our house but it's really tricky to find.

children.title: Archery
children.description: The guy will lend you a long bow for the price of the lesson. Felix brought his own.

children.title: Nicole
children.description: Nicole and baby Ana Rosa just moved to Berkeley from Germany. Welcome to Berkeley!

children.title: Alva
children.description: Alva is back in town, this time for good. Welcome back!

children.title: Peekaboo
children.description: Felix plays peekaboo with our young guest. Ana Rosa is 6 months old.

children.title: Summer Work
children.description: A not-so-fun aspect of summer 2012 is that Felix has had to work on his writing and spelling. He has been going to sessions with his educational therapist twice a week + doing some extra work at home. We hope it pays off.

children.title: Waterworld
children.description: We played hooky from karate camp one day and went to Waterworld in Concord. Fun!
